game

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • game.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.util.Observable
    This hand represents the 'hand' of a player in real life. A hand contains a player's tiles and the contents of the hand can be manipulated through various functions.
    Author:
    Jonathan Juursema & Peter Wessels TODO: make exceptions

    • Method Detail

      • hasInHand

        public boolean hasInHand(Tile tile)
        Check if the tile is currently in hand.
        Parameters:
        tile -
        Returns:
        true if tile is in hand.

      • hasInHand

        public boolean hasInHand(java.util.List<Tile> tiles)
        Check if the list of tiles are currently in hand. Returns false if even 1 of the tiles in the list is not in hand.
        Parameters:
        tiles - The list of tiles to be checked
        Returns:
        true if all tiles are in hand.

      • hardResetHand

        public java.util.List<Tile> hardResetHand()
        Reset the hand: it removes all the tiles an ensures that current hand is empty. Returns the tiles that are removed so that a bag of board can pick them.
        Returns:
        tiles that are removed for hand.

      • addToHand

        public void addToHand(Tile tile)
               throws HandLimitReachedExeption
        Adds a single tile-object to the player's hand to a random empty place.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile-object that needs to be added to the hand.
        Throws:
        HandLimitReachedExeption
